TopicTitle: Dres Awareness, Show Your Support! (still not-dead :))

Articles.Content:
On 25/08/2016 at 9:43 PM, ProtoJeb21 said:
  • DEMETER-CLASS MEGASHIPS: These are giant vessels meant to carry over a dozen Starblocks to the Dres Starbridge construction site in a 10km orbit. At least 3 will be made, and all of them will deliver their cargo at the same time. They will be nearly as large or bigger than the Dres Control Station.
  • CARPENTER DRONES: Giant probes with claws used to move and attach Starblocks together. They will be either 1.25 or 2.5 meters wide.

 

For the Demeter Megaships, i suggest some sort of 2001 Odyssey set up with a long, thin LF body with nukes on the back. This LF body should have a load of docking ports along the sides.

For the carpenter drones, i suggest scraping this idea and putting vernors around the segments

 

Hope this has helped

~Chad

Our crew has completed its Dres adventure.

In a short summary:

Spoiler
  • 10 ships left Kerbin with destination Dres
  • 27 Kerbals joined the party (that's all of them)
  • 4 rovers were deployed
  • 1 Polar Circumnavigation was completed by rover
  • 1 Resort was landed
  • 1 Orbital station was orbited
  • Many pods and dinghies were used
  • 1 hopper was flown around
  • 1 Class-E asteroid was captured and put in a low orbit
  • 4 contracts were completed
  • 7481.8 science was gathered 
  • 1 ship with 27 Kerbals was returned safely to Kerbin

See the adventure here:

Rejoice, Kerbonauts of low spec computer!

After intense thinking, I have decided to lower the challenge standards a BIT.

This will mean that smaller (not puny, but a bit smaller than huge) have a chance at making the supporter list!

GO ON, my fellow Kerbonauts, and embrace Dres with all you can!

(Extra credit for those who max out their computers in an attempt to complete their attempt.)

Another mini announcement: Any non-cheats mods are allowed! Give 'er all you got guys!

@SpaceplaneAddict

A question for you:

I may be attempting a Dres Colonization mission in the near-ish future. So I have a few questions.

  1. Can I do it in 64K (Kerbol system scaled up 6.4x) with RealFuels/Stockalike Configs? That is my current modlist, and probably will remain so since stock Kerbol system is not challenging enough for me. Context: LKO takes ~7.5 km/s of dV; Dres orbit from LKO is about 12.8 km/s; and Dres landing is about 1.3 km/s.
  2. I have a slew of other mods that I'd like to use, could you vet the mod list once I have it? I'm currently away from home (and therefore the computer with which I use to play KSP), so I'll get it to you once I am home. ETA 10:23 AM UTC - See spoiler for modlist.
Spoiler
  • ASET
  • Astrogator
  • B9 Procedural Wings
  • Bluedog Design Bureau (just the clamps)
  • Chatterer
  • Connected Living Space
  • Distant Object Enhancement
  • Docking Port Alignment Indicator
  • Docking Sound FX
  • Engine Lighting
  • Extraplanetary Launchpads
  • Kerbal Attachment System
  • Kerbal Alarm Clock
  • Kerbal Engineer Redux
  • Kerbal Joint Reinforcement
  • Kerbal Inventory System
  • Kerbal Planetary Base Systems
  • KScale64
  • Kopernicus
  • MechJeb
  • Procedural Fairings
  • Procedural Parts
  • RasterPropMonitor
  • RCS Build Aid
  • RealFuels
  • RealFuels Stock Configs
  • RealPlume
  • RealPlume Stock Configs
  • Ship Manifest
  • Sigma Dimensions
  • Stockalike Station Parts Expansion
  • TAC Life Support
  • Trajectories
  • Ven's Stock Revamp
  • VesselView

Thanks in advance and wish me luck!

Edited March 15, 2017 by TotallyNotHuman_
Added modlist

@TotallyNotHuman_

Mod list looks clear. Make sure to document the mission nicely, and goold luck!

Well, let's hope that you let me have USI mods - they make it harder - have to cope with life support and the fact that Kerbals get homesick if given squalid quarters for too long.

 

The network:

 

Most vessels in orbit are just shunts (= my nuclear powered pusher that moves payload from one body to another).  There's 6 satellites in the relay network - 1 polar, 1 at 45 degrees, 1 at -45 degrees, 1 polar, 1 low equatorial, 1 high equatorial and 1 on the rover-bus.

The spacestations:  Two, neither are that huge (one will serve as a return vehicle back to Kerbin or elsewhere) at around 40 tons undocked and 160 with the attached shunt. Presenting 'Henri Lagrange', and 'Gottfried Leibniz'.  Henri was previously sent to Moho, but naturally, he prefers Dres.

The plan is to take the parts from one of these and build it into a class E asteroid.  Of course, for that, we have an Asteroid Tug (currently in the process of being refuelled):

 

Rovers?  Sure.  We've got a Rover-Bus that transported 5 of the smaller variety.  We've also got another special one called the EV-18 - this serves to mine resources from anywhere on Dres and deliver it where's its needed, via orbit if necessary and can refuel itself.  And of course, no expedition to Dres is complete without a "Canyon Jumper".  Mad props to Mosy Kerman for being willing to try it (and survive!).

 

Landers?  Sure, apart from the EV-18 in the Rover class, we brought along 2 EV-17s - these can land, refuel themselves, carry up to 8 kerbals at a time, and are used for exploratory expeditions away from the main base, and can also mine and carry solid resources.  We also brought along an unmanned "Returner" so that the scientists back on Kerbin can squee with delight when they get a shipment of rocks and science from Dres.

 

Base? Sure, this is the 'Lynn Margulis'.  She's a bit fat - after landing and docking all the separate sections together she was around 200 tons, and is currently 1300 tons and climbing - she'll weigh over 2000 tons when completely full but it'll take a lot of time to process all of the relevant materials.  She can mine all resources, store all resources, and create all resources except for enriched uranium, and has a habitation rating of 100 years, because once you've reached Dres - why would you ever want to go home or anywhere else?  Situated conveniently close to the big canyon.  However, I know this will count against me - only 6 Kerbals made the trip - the base has a crew capacity of 109 however.

Finally, a screenshot of the mission plan (NB.  Second column is the initial kerbin orbit where things are docked to shunts, third column is updated as I move through maneuver nodes or else I tend to miss something - it gets an x when I have a good Dres intercept and an alarm clock entry for the SOI change).

Here's the imgur gallery link:

On 4/9/2017 at 9:45 AM, bigcalm said:

[Snipped Mission]

Oh. My.

That, is,

GORGEOUS! This mission is absolutely completely flawlessly textbook! You fulfilled EACH of the suggestion Criteria!

'Tis with the utmost praise, that I dare say,

Congratulations to @bigcalm, for completing the Dres Awareness challenge, with an absolutely beautiful textbook mission! I hope to see more missions like these in the future!

> Congratulations to @bigcalm, for completing the Dres Awareness challenge, with an absolutely beautiful textbook mission! I hope to see more missions like these in the future!

Thanks!  Glad you liked it - and a lot of credit to RoverDude for creating the wonderful USI mods.  They contribute a more in depth feel to visiting planets (or difficulty!) - there's a lot more planning required to send a manned mission - no stuffing your Kerbal in a Mk1 capsule for 2 years, it requires a big transfer vessel with room and supplies.  And then when you get there, they'll need somewhere to stay.  And that somewhere to stay needs resources.  Which you absolutely won't find in a single biome, which means mining drop ships that can move around the planet.  And ships to get from the surface to orbit again.  And a polar sat to do the initial scan for resources to find roughly where you need to land.  And rovers to get to the surface to find an ideal landing spot, generally in one biome and next to another, and as flat as possible.  And then you start to add parameters - make the surface base produce its own supplies, its own machinery, and you add fun stuff to that like the Canyon Jumper, and suddenly you have a 22 vessel mission :-)

Love Dres.
